Class SQLGenerator

extends Object
    Helper class that generates SQL queries with syntax specific to target DB todo: why throw MetaException?

    • Method Detail

      • createInsertValuesStmt

        public List<String> createInsertValuesStmt(String tblColumns,
                                           List<String> rows)
        Genereates "Insert into T(a,b,c) values(1,2,'f'),(3,4,'c')" for appropriate DB
        Parameters:
        tblColumns - e.g. "T(a,b,c)"
        rows - e.g. list of Strings like 3,4,'d'
        Returns:
        fully formed INSERT INTO ... statements

      • addForUpdateClause

        public String addForUpdateClause(String selectStatement)
                          throws MetaException
        Given a selectStatement, decorated it with FOR UPDATE or semantically equivalent construct. If the DB doesn't support, return original select.
        Throws:
        MetaException

      • addLimitClause

        public String addLimitClause(int numRows,
                             String noSelectsqlQuery)
                      throws MetaException
        Suppose you have a query "select a,b from T" and you want to limit the result set to the first 5 rows. The mechanism to do that differs in different DBs. Make noSelectsqlQuery to be "a,b from T" and this method will return the appropriately modified row limiting query.

        Note that if noSelectsqlQuery contains a join, you must make sure that all columns are unique for Oracle.

        Throws:
        MetaException

      • getDbProduct

        public DatabaseProduct getDbProduct()
